snippet.textDisplay: A week left and doesn't seem we are going to sign anyone. It's going to be a tough ride and nobody knows where we will end up. All this nonsense of supporting Ole seems a farce just like with any previous managers. There seems to be a pattern emerging with every manager since Sir Alex: 1. Get a new manager 2. Get a few signings in to appease fans 3. When the team is exposed for it's lack of quality 4. Noises about more incomings 5. End of the window, no more signings with appropriate excuses 6. More bad results 7. Mr. Woodward finds the perfect excuse of poor performances to fire the manager 8. A shiny new manager comes in with more noises of optimism And the cycle continues. Ole seems to be in the same queue now and awaiting his fate and soon we might have our next new messiah.
snippet.textOriginal: A week left and doesn't seem we are going to sign anyone. It's going to be a tough ride and nobody knows where we will end up. More bad results 7. Mr. Woodward finds the perfect excuse of poor performances to fire the manager 8. A shiny new manager comes in with more noises of optimism And the cycle continues. Ole seems to be in the same queue now and awaiting his fate and soon we might have our next new messiah.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh so it's the Glazer's fault now is it? the owners who helped UTD achieve a net spend of £611 million over the past 5 seasons? The same owners who have seen UTD lift the title 5 times since they took full control of the club? The same owners who Alex Ferguson served for a further 7 years after after they took over giving him 5 league titles in 8 seasons under the Glazers? The same Glazers that helped UTD become champions of Europe for the 3rd time in 2008? What a lot of bollocks!!!! When Fergy left UTD didn't just lose him, they lost his philosophy, it is what is known as the end of an era and sometimes we just have to accept these things rather than looking around for someone to pin all the blame on.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh so it's the Glazer's fault now is it? the owners who helped UTD achieve a net spend of £611 million over the past 5 seasons? The same owners who have seen UTD lift the title 5 times since they took full control of the club? The same Glazers that helped UTD become champions of Europe for the 3rd time in 2008? What a lot of bollocks!!!! When Fergy left UTD didn't just lose him, they lost his philosophy, it is what is known as the end of an era and sometimes we just have to accept these things rather than looking around for someone to pin all the blame on.

snippet.textDisplay: I think it's unfair to criticise passing out from the back. If De Gea goes long which we know isn't his strength, who does it go to? Dan James, Fred, Tony, Mata or Greenwood. Against a very strong direct Burnley team. Nah, not for me. Passing out from the back is the right tactic but we don't have good enough players to receive and turn with the ball in the midfield when it comes from Maguire. It's our biggest weakness we have and that's where 90% of the modern game is won or lost. This is a symptom of the Glazers through and through.
snippet.textOriginal: I think it's unfair to criticise passing out from the back. If De Gea goes long which we know isn't his strength, who does it go to? Dan James, Fred, Tony, Mata or Greenwood. snippet.textDisplay: Tonight game felt like the death of something. Sounds dramatic but it felt like the full stop of something whether it's the full stop of the time as a leading force in England or the full stop of the last seven years of the club reacting to disaster after disaster by rolling out the next disaster. That is completely in the hands of Glazers and Woodward. Where we go from here starts with them and it won't change overnight but something clearly needs to change. Before we even look at players, we need a plan. If your telling me we have one, I'd love to know what it is because it's in noway evident and hasn't been since Fergie left.
snippet.textOriginal: Tonight game felt like the death of something. Sounds dramatic but it felt like the full stop of something whether it's the full stop of the time as a leading force in England or the full stop of the last seven years of the club reacting to disaster after disaster by rolling out the next disaster. That is completely in the hands of Glazers and Woodward. Where we go from here starts with them and it won't change overnight but something clearly needs to change. Before we even look at players, we need a plan. If your telling me we have one, I'd love to know what it is because it's in noway evident and hasn't been since Fergie left.

snippet.textDisplay:
The problem with the Glazers is their inability to understand why United makes money. Despite what people constantly suggest on fan channels and in the media, football clubs ARE businesses and this is a good thing. It's just that United are NOT being run like a business, but a bank. To run a business, you first have to understand the product you're offering. A football club offers one product: football. The quality of this product has a direct impact on profitability in the long term. If the product is good, you attract fans, who pay into the club directly by attending matches and buying merchandise. In the modern game, a significant portion of profit will come through sponsorship and TV deals. The value of these deals is again directly related to the quality of the product: football. If nobody is watching, no company will pay to sponsor the club. If nobody is watching, TV deals will be worth less because there is reduced exposure for advertisers. The glazers are still making money from the legacy of United and the huge fanbase built up through years of providing a quality product that appealed to fans and led to United becoming a global brand. It will not continue indefinitely and very soon United will not be the top revenue-earners in the league.

TL;DR: The idea that the Glazers are somehow genius businessmen is a fallacy.
snippet.textOriginal:
The problem with the Glazers is their inability to understand why United makes money. Despite what people constantly suggest on fan channels and in the media, football clubs ARE businesses and this is a good thing. It's just that United are NOT being run like a business, but a bank. To run a business, you first have to understand the product you're offering. A football club offers one product: football. The quality of this product has a direct impact on profitability in the long term. If the product is good, you attract fans, who pay into the club directly by attending matches and buying merchandise. In the modern game, a significant portion of profit will come through sponsorship and TV deals. The value of these deals is again directly related to the quality of the product: football. If nobody is watching, no company will pay to sponsor the club. If nobody is watching, TV deals will be worth less because there is reduced exposure for advertisers. The glazers are still making money from the legacy of United and the huge fanbase built up through years of providing a quality product that appealed to fans and led to United becoming a global brand. It will not continue indefinitely and very soon United will not be the top revenue-earners in the league.

TL;DR: The idea that the Glazers are somehow genius businessmen is a fallacy.

snippet.textDisplay: No doubt about it Ole is making  team selection mistakes but with a bare bones squad to pick from thanks to useless woodward and the greedy glazers iam not going to judge him until if he`s given the time and money to build his team and squad as we all expected and hoped. One question I have to ask though is what are they doing in training. No high tempo one or two touch pass and move football like we used to play. Now it`s pass to get rid of the ball and stand there static, and in defence we don`t know how to cope with set pieces at all. Come on Ole sort it out even with the limited squad we`ve got we can do better than it is. Or we can kiss 4th spot or winning Europa league a big goodbye. MUMUFMUFC OK.

snippet.textDisplay: I know most people will disagree with this, but Ole's recruits, including AWB, have actually made Man Utd worse. When Ole first took this job, he had the players he needed to win games, and those players proved that in Ole's first 15 games. However, due to Ole's incompetence as a manager, he went on to sell key players including, Lukaku, Young, and Smalling and replaced with with even worse players in the form of AWB, Maguire, and James. This Man Utd team was built to play a 4 4 2 or a 3 5 2. Instead, Ole always plays a 4 2 3 1 irrespective of the opposition despite lacking key players to execute that system.
snippet.textOriginal: I know most people will disagree with this, but Ole's recruits, including AWB, have actually made Man Utd worse. When Ole first took this job, he had the players he needed to win games, and those players proved that in Ole's first 15 games. However, due to Ole's incompetence as a manager, he went on to sell key players including, Lukaku, Young, and Smalling and replaced with with even worse players in the form of AWB, Maguire, and James. This Man Utd team was built to play a 4 4 2 or a 3 5 2. Instead, Ole always plays a 4 2 3 1 irrespective of the opposition despite lacking key players to execute that system.

snippet.textDisplay: Make no mistake about it, with Rashford and McSauce out for long spells and Pogba on holiday; if we don't sign 3 genuinely first 11 improving players in the next week we are in serious trouble. Dan James and Fred need a rest, we need someone up top who can finish and some grit in CM alongside someone who can pass it forward in tight areas. Why people are expecting Ole to produce magic with that starting 11 is beyond me.  James has just come out the Championship, Greenwood still has a paper round, Andreas couldn't get a game at Valencia, Fred and Matic are 0% threat going forward. The kid Williams is probably our best player and DeGea has had a normal season vs a heroic one. He couldn't carry us forever.
snippet.textOriginal: Make no mistake about it, with Rashford and McSauce out for long spells and Pogba on holiday; if we don't sign 3 genuinely first 11 improving players in the next week we are in serious trouble. Dan James and Fred need a rest, we need someone up top who can finish and some grit in CM alongside someone who can pass it forward in tight areas. Why people are expecting Ole to produce magic with that starting 11 is beyond me.  James has just come out the Championship, Greenwood still has a paper round, Andreas couldn't get a game at Valencia, Fred and Matic are 0% threat going forward. The kid Williams is probably our best player and DeGea has had a normal season vs a heroic one. He couldn't carry us forever.
